props.summary:
### Summary of Core Topics, Concepts, Principles, and Equations

#### 1. **Optimization and Critical Points**
- **Gradient and Hessian Matrix**:
  - Gradient (\(\nabla f\)): Vector of partial derivatives.
  - Hessian Matrix (\(\nabla^2 f\)): Matrix of second partial derivatives.
- **Critical Points**:
  - If \(\nabla f(x^*) = 0\) and \(\nabla^2 f(x^*) > 0\), then \(x^*\) is a local minimum.
  - If \(\nabla f(x^*) = 0\) and \(\nabla^2 f(x^*) < 0\), then \(x^*\) is a local maximum.
  - If \(\nabla f(x^*) = 0\) and \(\nabla^2 f(x^*)\) is indefinite, then \(x^*\) is a saddle point.

#### 2. **Quadratic Forms and Definiteness**
- **Quadratic Form**: \(Q(x) = x^T A x\)
  - Positive Definite: \(Q(x) > 0\) for all \(x \neq 0\).
  - Positive Semi-Definite: \(Q(x) \geq 0\) for all \(x\).
  - Negative Definite: \(Q(x) < 0\) for all \(x \neq 0\).
  - Negative Semi-Definite: \(Q(x) \leq 0\) for all \(x\).

#### 3. **Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors**
- **Eigenvalue Equation**: \(A v = \lambda v\)
- **Properties of Hermitian Matrices**:
  - Eigenvalues are real.
  - Eigenvectors corresponding to different eigenvalues are orthogonal.
- **Singular Value Decomposition (SVD)**:
  - \(A = U \Sigma V^T\)
  - \(U\) and \(V\) are orthogonal matrices.
  - \(\Sigma\) is a diagonal matrix of singular values.

#### 4. **Principal Component Analysis (PCA)**
- **Covariance Matrix**: \(C = \frac{1}{n-1} X^T X\)
- **Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors of Covariance Matrix**:
  - Eigenvectors are the principal components.
  - Eigenvalues represent the variance along the principal components.
- **Projection**: Data is projected onto the eigenvectors with the highest eigenvalues.

#### 5. **Gradient Descent**
- **Update Rule**: \(x_{k+1} = x_k - \eta \nabla f(x_k)\)
- **Learning Rate (\(\eta\))**: Step size in the direction of the negative gradient.

### Equations

#### Optimization
- Gradient: \(\nabla f(x) = \left( \frac{\partial f}{\partial x_1}, \frac{\partial f}{\partial x_2}, \ldots, \frac{\partial f}{\partial x_n} \right)\)
- Hessian Matrix: \(\nabla^2 f(x) = \begin{bmatrix} \frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x_1^2} & \frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x_1 \partial x_2} & \cdots & \frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x_1 \partial x_n} \\ \frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x_2 \partial x_1} & \frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x_2^2} & \cdots & \frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x_2 \partial x_n} \\ \vdots & \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\ \frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x_n \partial x_1} & \frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x_n \partial x_2} & \cdots & \frac{\partial^2 f}{\partial x_n^2} \end{bmatrix}\)

#### Quadratic Forms
- Quadratic Form: \(Q(x) = x^T A x = \sum_{i=1}^n \sum_{j=1}^n a_{ij} x_i x_j\)

#### Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors
- Eigenvalue Equation: \(A v = \lambda v\)
- SVD: \(A = U \Sigma V^T\)

#### PCA
- Covariance Matrix: \(C = \frac{1}{n-1} X^T X\)
- Projection: \(Y = X V\), where \(V\) is the matrix of eigenvectors.

#### Gradient Descent
- Update Rule: \(x_{k+1} = x_k - \eta \nabla f(x_k)\)

### Knowledge Graph 

```mermaid
graph TD;
    A[Optimization] --> B[Gradient]
    A --> C[Hessian Matrix]
    B --> D[Critical Points]
    C --> D
    D --> E[Local Minimum]
    D --> F[Local Maximum]
    D --> G[Saddle Point]

    H[Quadratic Forms] --> I[Positive Definite]
    H --> J[Positive Semi-Definite]
    H --> K[Negative Definite]
    H --> L[Negative Semi-Definite]

    M[Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors] --> N[Eigenvalue Equation]
    M --> O[Hermitian Matrices]
    O --> P[Real Eigenvalues]
    O --> Q[Orthogonal Eigenvectors]
    M --> R[Singular Value Decomposition]
    R --> S[U Matrix]
    R --> T[Sigma Matrix]
    R --> U[V Matrix]

    V[Principal Component Analysis] --> W[Covariance Matrix]
    V --> X[Eigenvalues]
    V --> Y[Eigenvectors]
    V --> Z[Projection]

    AA[Gradient Descent] --> AB[Update Rule]
    AA --> AC[Learning Rate]
```

```mermaid
graph TD;
    A[Optimization] --> B[Gradient Descent]
    A --> C[Critical Points]
    C --> D[Local Minimum]
    C --> E[Local Maximum]
    C --> F[Saddle Point]

    G[Quadratic Forms] --> H[Positive Definite]
    G --> I[Positive Semi-Definite]
    G --> J[Negative Definite]
    G --> K[Negative Semi-Definite]

    L[Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors] --> M[Eigenvalue Equation]
    L --> N[Hermitian Matrices]
    N --> O[Real Eigenvalues]
    N --> P[Orthogonal Eigenvectors]
    L --> Q[Singular Value Decomposition]
    Q --> R[U Matrix]
    Q --> S[Sigma Matrix]
    Q --> T[V Matrix]

    U[Principal Component Analysis] --> V[Covariance Matrix]
    U --> W[Eigenvalues]
    U --> X[Eigenvectors]
    U --> Y[Projection]

    Z[Gradient Descent] --> AA[Update Rule]
    Z --> AB[Learning Rate]
```

These graphs provide a visual representation of the relationships between the core topics in the exam.
